article.title: A Face-on Accretion System in High-Mass Star-Formation: Possible Dusty Infall Streams within 100 AU

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1: This figure shows a 45 GHz continuum image from J-VLA and a VLBI map of the H2O maser jet. What information is represented by the color of the filled circles in the figure?
choices: Brightness temperature of the maser spots
Line-of-sight velocity of the maser spots

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2: This figure presents two continuum images at 6 GHz (top) and 9 GHz (bottom) taken by ATCA. What is the shape of the continuum source at both frequencies?
Figure 6: This figure shows the SED of G353 at IR wavelengths. What does the relatively flat SED shape suggest about the geometry of the object?
choices: It is a nearly edge-on object.
It is a nearly face-on object.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (2): This formula describes the LOS velocity (Vmod) in the parabolic infall model. What does the term \'cosθ1cosθ2\' represent in this formula?
choices: The projection of the infall velocity onto the line of sight.
The effect of centrifugal force on the infall motion.
The contribution of thermal pressure to the velocity field.
The gravitational acceleration due to the central YSO.
